Pros : 
I have been going to dr. Chockalingam for the last 12 years for my kids and for my parents . An exceptionally brilliant doctor , very calm and composed . He explains clearly the treatment and the procedure.  Best paediatric and geriatric dentist. 
Con: the wait time can be managed better .

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: Dr. Chockalingam is a thorough professional. There‚Äôs a general notion of fear when visiting a dentist, but his friendly & calm personality makes us comfortable immediately. He took the time to explain the condition of my teeth and the treatment that‚Äôll be done. During the procedure too, I was made aware of what‚Äôs being done at every step. Clear instructions on after care, next follow up etc. The wait time at the clinic is something that bothered me at first, but that is justifiable as he takes time with every patient and doesn‚Äôt rush them off for his next appointment. Two of my closest relatives who‚Äôve been postponing their dentist visit have seen the doctor after hearing my experience. Anyone in & around the vicinity of Velachery, Dr. Chockalingam should be your default choice for your dental problems.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review: I had visited Dr.Chockalingam for my 3 year old daughter's teeth issues. She had early childhood caries and was advised pulpectomy for 7 teeth with cleaning. Since she was a small child I was apprehensive of going ahead with the treatment (which went on for upto 6 sittings) as I was not sure if she will co operate. But the doctor was extremely gentle and patient with the child and managed to get the job done with a local anesthesia. He explained every step of the process patiently, both to the child as well as to us (parents). Posting this message so that other anxious parents could make the right decision. The alternate was to give general anesthesia and get the whole job done in a single sitting. I was not fine with this approach as I felt she was too young. Thankfully this doctor gave me confidence and finished it without going through the GA step. I would recommend him for kids' dental procedures.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: We knew Chockalingam sir for last 8years through one of my friend's reference. At that time my kid got accident in stairs and his upper jaw with teeths got damaged. Being a kid of 1.5yrs, he suffered a lot with pain. I went to few very famous speciality hospitals, but their process were little contradict and high charges was quoted. Finally went to Chockalingam sir and being a Pediatric Dentist, he took necessary steps to take care of our child. In previous enquired hospitals they advised us to take operation for our kid. But Chockalingam sir said it should be avoided as we recently done plastic surgery for my kid and immediately second time giving anesthesia is not advisable. This important thing other doctors didn't advise us. And till date for last 8years with periodical review and explaining problem at regular intervals, we see him as a gem. He not only took care of my kid but also my wallet. üëçüèº

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
I have been consulting Dr.chockalingam for 1+ year for my 2 year old cavity issues. He is very friendly and explain the problem with patience. He is expertise in handling kids! Breastfeeding friendly.

Then I myself  consulted for wisdom tooth extraction and root canal treatment. Such a wonderful experience! He explain about the problem and procedures before hand and answer all my silly queries. Always available on phone for any doubts. Getting appointments,  reminders for the appointment, feedback calls after treatment these are their perfect services.

As well I love their eco friendly choices no paper prescriptions everytime, just a single card for registration( medication details sent clearly to email/mobile number) and very less paper cover usage for medicine packing.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: my son was suffering tooth ache due to cavity issue.  he is 4years old. when we consulted nearby dentist they said he has cavities on 4teeths and advised to do root carnel treatment. first we got fear, how to do root carnel for small kid.  we tried to get mutiple opinons in which the most of the dentist is doing procedure with full anusthesia or local anusthesia with smiling gas.so we had fear to do root carnel and  postponed the treatment . luckily we got dr.chokalingam  sir clinic details via one of my friend. we went to clinic to get details about the issue. during first visit itslef we got confident the way he explained about problem and the procedure steps he follows. doctor advised us to come 5sittings.  we decided to go further, however we had fear how my son would co-operate for procedure. doctor is giving confidence to kid based on his procedure style. even my son is not denied to go for subsequent procedure.  we completed all sittings  and resolved issue with local anusthesia for each jaw.we are really happy, my son could eat all foods without any issues. even we wnet for reviews after 1month.Thanks a lot to  dr.chokalingam sir and clinical staffs..

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
I recently visited Dr. Chockalingam for a second opinion on a root canal procedure that had been suggested by another doctor. 

      Dr. Chockalingam took the time to carefully examine my teeth and explain the different treatment options available to me. He also explained the pros and cons of each option in detail, and helped me to make the best decision for my individual needs.
         I am very happy with the way that Dr. Chockalingam approached me and treated me. He is a very ************* *** experienced dentist, and he is also very patient and kind. He took the time to answer all of my questions and concerns, and he made sure that I was comfortable with every step of the treatment process.
          I would highly recommend Dr. Chockalingam to anyone looking for a skilled and compassionate dentist. He is a true professional, and I am very grateful for his care.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,
review: Every time we book appointments before every visit. But we have to wait invariably for atleast 30-45 mins. This should be improved and appointment time should be adhered every time. It‚Äôs ok we wait for 2-5 mins. This makes visitors to look for some other doctor.
reply_text:
Dear Mr Ramesh,  appointment timings are indicative and not ardent. Rendering healthcare service is complex and no-one (the doctor included) can give a fare guess of how long each procedure is going to take. The accuracy of the guess gets ruptured more when treatment involves young children. In such a scenario half an hour waiting time is fair from our perspective.

Also patients with dental emergencies(accute dental pain) need to be accommodated in the schedule amidst appointments. Onset of Dental pain does not fetch an appointment before it arrives.

You waiting time should have been because of these probabilities. 

However, the waiting time can be offset by deputing work, meaning scattering work with other doctors which we don't believe. 

Hence, conclusively-if the waiting time bothers,you can either choose the first appointment of the day or choose another doctor.
Thank you for the feedback that made us recapitulate with ourselves of what we do and believe.
